page.title: 11PITTENDREICH MILL.
page.content:
Pittendreich Mill, Elgin
Pittendreich Mill was built over 100 years ago by Moray Estates. Water from the Black Burn turned the mill wheel which operated the mill-stone. Oats were first thoroughly dried over a huge kiln and then milled to make oat-meal. The mill was used until the 1930s, lay unused for a number of years and was bought in 1976 by Mr. Russell, an architect, and his wife who have altered it and made it their home. And a very interesting home it is. The kiln, with its quaint chimney has been retained. One mill-stone is a feature of the lounge and the other is embedded in a grassy bank outside. Many buildings are now used for a purpose different from that for which they were built.
